alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 9:19PM EST until January 09 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.6 to 7.8 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 7 AM EST Wednesday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 5:57 AM Tuesday at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 2 to 3 hours before and after high tide. Enhanced beach erosion is possible, especially in areas that were damaged by the December nor`easter. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/06 AM 7.7 1.9 2.2 N/A Moderate 09/06 PM 6.5 0.7 2.1 N/A None 10/07 AM 4.4 -1.4 -1.4 N/A None 10/07 PM 4.5 -1.3 -0.1 N/A None 11/08 AM 6.2 0.4 0.2 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
